basics.name: Riley Cammack
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the College of Engineering and a Minor in Mathematics at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring 2019 and plan to work as a software engineer after graduation.

highlights: Teaching a lab section and grading lab reports for students enrolled in the course Programming in C for Engineers
Graded quizzes and homework assignments for EE 160 (Intro to Programming in C), EE 315 (Signals and Systems), and EE 342 (Probability and Statistics)
Created a dashboard for the Department of Health's Opioid Initiative to display graphs, maps, and counters using Chart.js with data parsed from Excel workbooks using a custom Python parser
Researched, tested, and gave a presentation on the static code analysis tool SonarQube
Worked in an Agile, collaborative environment with daily team huddles to monitor each individual’s progress
Wrote and documented Selenium tests in JavaScript using Nightwatch.js, a Node.js powered testing framework
Reported website bugs found from ad hoc testing; quality checked the development team’s bug fixes
Used Python to automate web scraping sites; organized and populated that data on clients' sites

volunteer.organization: National Honor Society for Electrical and Computer Engineers
volunteer.position: Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) Member and Officer (Pledge Master)
highlights: Volunteer for educational events and community service projects
Organizer for community service projects, socials, workshops, and other various activities for the members

volunteer.organization: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) Student Branch
highlights: Organizer and volunteer for various IEEE Student Branch events including technical workshops, outreach events, and general meetings

volunteer.organization: University of Hawaii at Manoa Honors Program
highlights: Volunteer for Scholar-to-Scholar Day where new Regent and Chancellor Scholars learn about and explore the UH campus
Successful completion of lower division Honors Program consisting of at least 4 accelerated and honors-distinction courses
